whose chattering voices had reached her from the cor- ridor, went into Princess Mary's room. 
"You know they've come, Marie?" said the little princess, waddling in, and sinking heav- ily into an armchair. 
She was no longer in the loose gown she gen- erally wore in the morning, but had on one of her best dresses. Her hair was carefully done and her face was animated, which, however, did not conceal its sunken and faded outlines. Dressed as she used to be in Petersburg society, it was still m
